00029 #ifndef __BMESH_ITERATORS_INLINE_H__
00030 #define __BMESH_ITERATORS_INLINE_H__
00031 
00032 /* inline here optimizes out the switch statement when called with
00033  * constant values (which is very common), nicer for loop-in-loop situations */
00034 
00040 BLI_INLINE void *BM_iter_step(BMIter *iter)
00041 {
00042     return iter->step(iter);
00043 }
00044 
00045 
00053 BLI_INLINE int BM_iter_init(BMIter *iter, BMesh *bm, const char itype, void *data)
00054 {
00055     /* int argtype; */
00056     iter->itype = itype;
00057     iter->bm = bm;
00058 
00059     /* inlining optimizes out this switch when called with the defined type */
00060     switch ((BMIterType)itype) {
00061         case BM_VERTS_OF_MESH:
00062             BLI_assert(bm != NULL);
00063             BLI_assert(data == NULL);
00064             iter->begin = bmiter__vert_of_mesh_begin;
00065             iter->step =  bmiter__vert_of_mesh_step;
00066             break;
00067         case BM_EDGES_OF_MESH:
00068             BLI_assert(bm != NULL);
00069             BLI_assert(data == NULL);
00070             iter->begin = bmiter__edge_of_mesh_begin;
00071             iter->step =  bmiter__edge_of_mesh_step;
00072             break;
00073         case BM_FACES_OF_MESH:
00074             BLI_assert(bm != NULL);
00075             BLI_assert(data == NULL);
00076             iter->begin = bmiter__face_of_mesh_begin;
00077             iter->step =  bmiter__face_of_mesh_step;
00078             break;
00079         case BM_EDGES_OF_VERT:
00080             if (UNLIKELY(!data)) {
00081                 return FALSE;
00082             }
00083 
00084             iter->begin = bmiter__edge_of_vert_begin;
00085             iter->step =  bmiter__edge_of_vert_step;
00086             iter->vdata = data;
00087             break;
00088         case BM_FACES_OF_VERT:
00089             if (UNLIKELY(!data)) {
00090                 return FALSE;
00091             }
00092 
00093             iter->begin = bmiter__face_of_vert_begin;
00094             iter->step =  bmiter__face_of_vert_step;
00095             iter->vdata = data;
00096             break;
00097         case BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT:
00098             if (UNLIKELY(!data)) {
00099                 return FALSE;
00100             }
00101 
00102             iter->begin = bmiter__loop_of_vert_begin;
00103             iter->step =  bmiter__loop_of_vert_step;
00104             iter->vdata = data;
00105             break;
00106         case BM_VERTS_OF_EDGE:
00107             if (UNLIKELY(!data)) {
00108                 return FALSE;
00109             }
00110 
00111             iter->begin = bmiter__vert_of_edge_begin;
00112             iter->step =  bmiter__vert_of_edge_step;
00113             iter->edata = data;
00114             break;
00115         case BM_FACES_OF_EDGE:
00116             if (UNLIKELY(!data)) {
00117                 return FALSE;
00118             }
00119 
00120             iter->begin = bmiter__face_of_edge_begin;
00121             iter->step =  bmiter__face_of_edge_step;
00122             iter->edata = data;
00123             break;
00124         case BM_VERTS_OF_FACE:
00125             if (UNLIKELY(!data)) {
00126                 return FALSE;
00127             }
00128 
00129             iter->begin = bmiter__vert_of_face_begin;
00130             iter->step =  bmiter__vert_of_face_step;
00131             iter->pdata = data;
00132             break;
00133         case BM_EDGES_OF_FACE:
00134             if (UNLIKELY(!data)) {
00135                 return FALSE;
00136             }
00137 
00138             iter->begin = bmiter__edge_of_face_begin;
00139             iter->step =  bmiter__edge_of_face_step;
00140             iter->pdata = data;
00141             break;
00142         case BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE:
00143             if (UNLIKELY(!data)) {
00144                 return FALSE;
00145             }
00146 
00147             iter->begin = bmiter__loop_of_face_begin;
00148             iter->step =  bmiter__loop_of_face_step;
00149             iter->pdata = data;
00150             break;
00151         case BM_LOOPS_OF_LOOP:
00152             if (UNLIKELY(!data)) {
00153                 return FALSE;
00154             }
00155 
00156             iter->begin = bmiter__loops_of_loop_begin;
00157             iter->step =  bmiter__loops_of_loop_step;
00158             iter->ldata = data;
00159             break;
00160         case BM_LOOPS_OF_EDGE:
00161             if (UNLIKELY(!data)) {
00162                 return FALSE;
00163             }
00164 
00165             iter->begin = bmiter__loops_of_edge_begin;
00166             iter->step =  bmiter__loops_of_edge_step;
00167             iter->edata = data;
00168             break;
00169         default:
00170             /* should never happen */
00171             BLI_assert(0);
00172             return FALSE;
00173             break;
00174     }
00175     
00176     iter->begin(iter);
00177 
00178     return TRUE;
00179 }
00180 
00190 BLI_INLINE void *BM_iter_new(BMIter *iter, BMesh *bm, const char itype, void *data)
00191 {
00192     if (LIKELY(BM_iter_init(iter, bm, itype, data))) {
00193         return BM_iter_step(iter);
00194     }
00195     else {
00196         return NULL;
00197     }
00198 }
00199 
00200 #endif /* __BMESH_ITERATORS_INLINE_H__ */
